task_summary: Detect, align to, and push the red Coca-Cola bottle laterally across the tabletop, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed UR-style manipulator must push the Coca-Cola bottle on a white tabletop among several other objects (green bottle, blue can/bottle, colored cups/blocks). The robot first ensures the target is perceived, then approaches and aligns its tool to a neutral yaw. Without grasping, it performs a lateral push motion on the bottle for a short distance, after which it retreats and pauses. The scene is cluttered but static; pushing should avoid tipping or colliding with nearby items.
preconditions: Workspace is clear of unexpected obstacles around push path
Coca-Cola bottle is standing and visible
Robot reachable workspace includes target and push path
stepwise_plan: Detect or scan for the Coca-Cola bottle.
Verify visibility and approach while aligning end-effector.
Set tool yaw and ensure gripper is open.
Execute a lateral push on the bottle.
Retreat and briefly wait to stabilize.
success_criteria: Bottle is displaced along intended lateral direction by ~0.15 m
No toppling of the target or collisions with other objects
Robot ends in a safe, retracted pose
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, scan in a spiral pattern and retry.
If alignment drifts, re-run ApproachAndAlign and reset yaw.
If push stalls due to friction, attempt a second push with adjusted approach (not encoded here).
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after retreating and waiting briefly following a successful push.

frame_3.now_evidence: Arm is aligned close to the bottle with clear contact-ready pose.
frame_3.predicts_next: Push actuation expected; orientation suggests lateral motion.

node_specs.description: Perceive the Coca-Cola bottle using a quick detection step.
Active scan to find the bottle when initial detection fails.
Gate that confirms the bottle is visible before approach.
Move and align end-effector near the bottle with tight tolerance.
Orient the tool for a straight lateral push.
Ensure the gripper is open to avoid grasping while pushing.
Perform the lateral push (to robot-right) on the bottle.
Back away to a safe distance after the push.
Brief pause to allow scene stabilization.

failure_modes: Target not detected due to occlusion or lighting
Misalignment causing grazing instead of a firm push
Collision with neighboring objects during lateral motion
recovery_strategy: Fallback to spiral scan with retry on detection
Re-run ApproachAndAlign if contact not established
Reduce push distance or adjust direction on repeated failure
Abort and retreat if unexpected contact forces occur
assumptions: The red bottle is the Coca-Cola target; color/label inferred from frames.
Push direction assumed to the robot’s right (90°) based on layout; exact goal not annotated.
No explicit force limits were provided by the instruction; default bins used.

expected_success_criteria: Bottle laterally displaced ~0.15 m without toppling
Robot maintains clearance from other objects
Sequence completes with retreat and wait
